result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danial Lisa Clifton

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Danial Lisa Clifton in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Danial Lisa Clifton.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt. 
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Case in court with 22cm187 and 22CM186. Victim A.L. in court and statement made. Discussions regarding monitoring. Case to be staffed. Court orders case adjourned, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pretrial Supervision Report, received and filed
Jury instructions for plea hearing

Defendant Danial Lisa Clifton in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Danial Lisa Clifton.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. 

Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY on counts 1 & 2

Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Review Hearing scheduled
Review hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Danial Lisa Clifton in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Danial Lisa Clifton appeared by video means with Attorney. Defense informed the Court that TAD results were received and awaiting on a proposed DPA from State.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected Deferred Prosecution Hearing in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Status Report received and filed.

Defendant Danial Lisa Clifton in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court canceled the stayed bench warrant based on defendant's appearance in court.  Case in court with 22CM186/187.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report, received and filed.
Pretrial Services Status Report 5-4-2022, filed.  rmm

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Case in Court for bail/bond hearing. Defendant is not present, unable to secure alternate transportation. State feels bail hearing is not necessary. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
Corey Flynn

Defendant Danial Lisa Clifton in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail/bond hearing. State is not prepared to make a bail argument at this time. Court adjourns matter to allow time to prepare a bail argument. Case remains calendared in Br. 37.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
22RM015262  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff 03/19/2022
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Alleged victim:  Angela L.L. in court.  
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
Court ordered Defendant provide updated address at next court hearing.

Court ordered no contact with ALL (subscript 1:  ALL is the defendant's mother.  The State proposes that ALL and the defendant to be able to communicate about her mental health condition OVER THE PHONE)
REVISED No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Danial Lisa Clifton in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Danial Lisa Clifton in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Danial Lisa Clifton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  State request bail hearing. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
